title.value: Crystal-GFN: sampling crystals with desirable properties and constraints
title.justification: This value represents the full title of the provided research paper.
title.quote: Crystal-GFN: sampling crystals with desirable properties and constraints

extractions.description: This paper introduces Crystal-GFN, a generative model for crystal structures that samples structural properties, such as space group, composition, and lattice parameters. The model incorporates physical and structural constraints and uses a proxy machine learning model to predict formation energy per atom. The results demonstrate Crystal-GFN's ability to sample diverse crystals with low predicted formation energy.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical evaluation of the proposed Crystal-GFN model, including training on a dataset and measuring its performance in terms of sampled crystal diversity and predicted formation energy.
type.quote: In our evaluation in Section 5, we sampled 10,000 compounds from the trained Crystal-GFN to demonstrate that it is able to sample diverse candidates with low predicted formation energy.

name.justification: The paper focuses on generating materials with specific properties using machine learning models.
name.quote: In this paper, we introduce Crystal-GFN, a generative model of crystal structures that sequentially samples structural properties of crystalline materials, namely the space group, composition and lattice parameters.

name.justification: The work involves sampling crystal structures and incorporates principles of theoretical crystallography.
name.quote: Instead of directly generating atomic positions, Crystal-GFN samples the space group, the composition and the lattice parameters of a crystal structure (Section 4). This domain-inspired approach facilitates the incorporation of physicochemical and structural constraints.

name.justification: The research uses machine learning models for the discovery and generation of new crystal structures.
name.quote: This approach utilizes a new proxy machine learning model trained on MatBench to predict the formation energy per atom of a crystal structure.

name.justification: Crystal-GFN is the primary generative model introduced and evaluated in the paper.
name.quote: In this paper, we introduce Crystal-GFN, a generative model of crystal structures that sequentially samples structural properties of crystalline materials, namely the space group, composition and lattice parameters.

is_contributed.justification: Crystal-GFN is the main contribution of the research paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we introduce Crystal-GFN, a generative model of crystal structures...

is_executed.justification: The model was executed and evaluated in the scope of the paper.
is_executed.quote: we sampled 10,000 compounds from the trained Crystal-GFN to demonstrate that it is able to sample diverse candidates with low predicted formation energy.

is_compared.justification: The performance of Crystal-GFN was compared to previous methods and studied in detail.
is_compared.quote: The main conclusion is that Crystal-GFN samples candidates with very high diversity.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Crystal-GFN is introduced and evaluated in this paper itself, so there is no previously referenced paper for this model.

name.justification: The dataset used to train the proxy machine-learning model for predicting formation energy is MatBench.
name.quote: Here, we use as objective the formation energy per atom of a crystal structure predicted by a new proxy machine learning model trained on MatBench.

referenced_paper_title.value: Benchmarking materials property prediction methods: The MatBench test set and automatminer reference algorithm.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides the MatBench test set and the automatminer reference algorithm, which were used to evaluate material property prediction methods.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Benchmarking materials property prediction methods: The MatBench test set and automatminer reference algorithm.

name.justification: The paper mentions using PhAST for obtaining physical embeddings of the crystal's elements.
name.quote: A physical embedding of the crystalâ€™s elements, obtained using PhAST (Duval et al., 2022), that is, from the atomic number, the period, the group, and other relevant atomic properties.

referenced_paper_title.value: PhAST: Physics-Aware, Scalable, and Task-Specific GNNs for Accelerated Catalyst Design
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references another work that describes the PhAST method used in the proxy model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: PhAST: Physics-Aware, Scalable, and Task-Specific GNNs for Accelerated Catalyst Design
